identificationModule.briefTitle: Effect of Home Based Swallowing Exercise in Stroke Patients With Dysphagia
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Home Based Swallowing Exercise in Stroke Patients With Dysphagia

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Dysphagia is a common problem in post-stroke patients and greatly impaired quality of life. Among them, the strength of tongue and lip muscles played a key role in the oral phase of swallowing and many stroke survivors suffered from these muscles weakness. Iowa oral performance instrument (IOPI) is a standardized portable device that can be used to quantify tongue muscle strength, thus allowing the clinician to set the level of resistance necessary to achieve optimal gains in strength, and also providing visual feedback of performance to the patients to guide training. In this study, we use Videofluoroscopic Swallowing Study (VFSS) to screen for the stroke patient suffering from dysphagia and recruited them into the trial. They then participated in a home based resistance-training program using the tongue depressor, 1 time everyday and each time consisted of 30 repetitions, totally 4 weeks. Various tongue strength variables and subjective scale were obtained before and after the intervention. The purpose of the study was to evaluate the effect of the home based swallowing therapy in the post stroke dysphagia patients.

armGroups.label: Iowa Oral Performance Instrument (IOPI) training group
armGroups.description: Including conventional speech therapy (tongue range of motion and strength, oral diet suggestion, masseter muscle strengthening) and home- IOPI based resistance training
interventionNames: Behavioral: home based IOPI swallow training

armGroups.label: controlled group
armGroups.description: Including conventional speech therapy (tongue range of motion and strength, oral diet suggestion, masseter muscle strengthening) only

interventions.name: home based IOPI swallow training
interventions.description: Use IOPI for tongue and labial muscle resistance training. Conventional training was the same as controlled group.
armGroupLabels: Iowa Oral Performance Instrument (IOPI) training group

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Acute stroke within 1 year, videofluoroscopic swallow study revealed abnormalities
* Mini-Mental Status Examination \>20, could cooperate swallow therapy

Exclusion Criteria:

* Already known dysphagia before stroke event
* Malocclusion or severe facial palsy
* Localized oral lesion interfering swallowing
